data.description:
ArbitrumDAO and RnDAO have come together to build a new kind of entrepreneurship program, starting with idea-stage fellowships for builders to dive deep into a problem, and followed by a venture-building program to fast-track the creation of a composable product ecosystem.

The focus is on Collaboration Tech - the combined space of organizational management, community, DAO, and other collaboration tooling for the future of work. A market poised to reach $380bn by 2030 and transform how we address global challenges.

We are offering a 3-month paid fellowship ($2,000/month stipend) to 6 aspiring entrepreneurs for deep research into fundamental challenges in the collaboration space.
data.title: ArbitrumDAO & RnDAO Co.Lab Fellowship

questions.query: How should the success of your grant be measured?
What is the intended direct impact your project will have on the ecosystem?
What is the long-term impact of your grant?

data.reason:
Initial sense-making in small groups (e.g. core teams) is currently the most underserved need in online governance. Itâ€™s currently addressed with solutions like interviews, workshops and surveys, none of which enable fast and scalable sense-making. This problem space relies heavily on facilitation skills of people responsible for governance or strategy. Instead of optimising voting and delegation systems (that re-create the problems of the outdated real-life democracies), the most impactful solutions will address the problem of facilitation. Modern LLMs have the potential to make it much easier for organisations to identify tensions, goals, and generate collective intelligence artefacts that would ensure higher alignment and legitimacy of their decisions. This paper is an attempt to bridge the gap between decentralised governance and deliberative democracy as they face a lot of common challenges and both can benefit from deploying AI / LLMs at scale.

In addition to user research, I described the landscape of existing sensemaking tools using Wardley Mapping:
![image](https://blog.getharmoni.ca/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fstorage.googleapis.com%2Fpapyrus_images%2F8858e64122d478a9a3705b7e95b71d79.jpg&w=1920&q=75)

Full paper is published in our blog: https://blog.getharmoni.ca/before-the-proposal

Facilitation of sensemaking takes too much time and effort â€“ normally 1-2 months of hard work to engage more people and process their inputs. This limits the agility and effectiveness of DAOs in defining direction and making decisions.

data.title: Desk research and insights from 10+ user interviews

data.reason:
Interviewed 13 governance leads, consultants and facilitators who had recently engaged their communities into sensemaking activities. 

Key struggles during the initial sense-making stage include:

- Getting the right people involved (with high context)
- Knowledge management as a key limitation
- Lack of skills and/or experience in facilitation
- Conflict avoidance
- Some people are not used to Miro

Key struggles during the validation stage include:

- Reaching out to delegates (doxxed only in big DAOs with >5000 members)
- Wisdom vs. popularity (people don't share the hard truth)
- Low engagement (only 10% fill out surveys)
- Processing of input takes a lot of time
- Fragmented communities are hard to engage and align
- Need to assign different weights

Detailed summaries of the interviews can be found here https://rndadocs.notion.site/14551d98aa8149c9aa8e3583f1d7b3a7?v=c2ee146aa778432ba14eefa23ceda650&pvs=4

Interviewed 13 governance leads, consultants and facilitators who had recently engaged their communities into sensemaking activities. 

Key struggles during the initial sense-making stage include:

- Getting the right people involved (with high context)
- Knowledge management as a key limitation
- Lack of skills and/or experience in facilitation
- Conflict avoidance
- Some people are not used to Miro

Key struggles during the validation stage include:

- Reaching out to delegates (doxxed only in big DAOs with >5000 members)
- Wisdom vs. popularity (people don't share the hard truth)
- Low engagement (only 10% fill out surveys)
- Processing of input takes a lot of time
- Fragmented communities are hard to engage and align
- Need to assign different weights

Detailed summaries of the interviews can be found here https://rndadocs.notion.site/14551d98aa8149c9aa8e3583f1d7b3a7?v=c2ee146aa778432ba14eefa23ceda650&pvs=4

data.description:
# Using AI to Generate Facilitation Templates

This project is focused on implementing AI-generated facilitation templates. This will enable users of Harmonica (session hosts) to create custom templates to address their teams' objectives and use the appropriate facilitation frameworks. Once generated and proven to be useful, these templates can be saved to Harmonica's library to be used by other teams in the future.

This project primarily targets governance leads and facilitators, addressing the core need for effective group sense-making. It aims to equip all participants with the tools to contribute meaningfully to strategic deliberations, thereby making the process fairer and more productive.

Post-funding, the project aims to become a perennial good and achieve commercial sustainability. We want to make the core functionality available for free, allowing teams to customize their facilitation exprerience. Template library will enable users to publish their templates.

# How is the project CollabTech?

Harmonica has been supported by RnDAO for the past year as one of its CollabTech ventures. Our SaaS platform is designed as a collaboration tool for any group or community, DAO or workplace to facilitate async meetings between contributors, improving the engagement, efficiency and effectiveness of group collaboration. As remote teams become the norm in working life, removing meeting friction and improving the user experience of collaboration is central to the evolution to a successful future of work.

The specific project for which we are seeking funding lies at the heart of the Harmonica mission. This funding will not only enable any group to create a template for their own style of meeting facilitation by using a template editor but also allow them to add their template to Harmonica's library to let other users benefit from it.

In essence, we are seeking funding to build a core piece of the Harmonica infrastructure that will generate an infinite variety of solutions tailored to meet specific collaboration contexts.

# Who's the targeted user group and what's the need/problem being addressed?

All groups need to generate, align and execute on strategic decisions as group decision-making is at the heart of collaborative projects. Ensuring that all decision makers are equipped to participate effectively is a major collaboration challenge and good sense-making is a critical pre-requisite to making good decisions that are perceived by participants to be fair.

[Our research for the RnDAO CoLab Fellowship funded by Arbitrum](https://blog.harmonica.chat/before-the-proposal) (written between Jan-Mar 2024) showed that DAO members desperately seek alignment but often struggle to generate essential strategic artefacts that articulate their intent such as OKRs, purpose statements, RFPs, etc. These collective intelligence artifacts are essential because they serve as a scaffolding for decision-making. However, they are often co-created by small groups of people needing high context (i.e. initial sense-making). This relies heavily on the facilitation skills of governance leads or someone responsible for strategy. This facilitation of sense-making takes too much time and effort both before and after the proposal â€“ normally 1-2 months of hard work - to engage people and process their inputs.
data.title: CollabTech Round and Thresholds Experiment

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: First, we're using AI to enable async multiplayer sensemaking. Any org can benefit from higher engagement and efficiency of sensemaking, but OSS communities and DAOs are struggling with it in particular. Second, Harmonica is OSS from Day 1, it's being incubated as one of RnDAO ventures, we're participating in Metagov Interoperable Deliberative Tools cohort (all of their projects are OSS), we're aiming to maximize composability with other OSS gov tools like Snapshot and Pol.is and encouraging everyone to contribute, integrate or build on top of Harmonica.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
Harmonica is an AI-powered tool for collective sensemaking. It's using GPT, but in multiplayer mode and in combination with advanced facilitation prompts based on popular frameworks like Sociocracy, Liberating Structures, TRIZ, Delphi method, etc. It allows teams and communities to run async workshops and collectively create artifacts (such as roadmaps, canvases, OKRs) in a matter of minutes instead of weeks.

In other words, Harmonica can be viewed as a post-GPT alternative to forums, surveys and workshops. On the other hand, it offers a much better UX than old deliberative tools like Pol.is

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
After finishing the MVP (to be released in November), weâ€™re focused on developing advanced AI features to enable better facilitation experience:
- Reasoning Capabilities: Incorporates advanced reasoning algorithms to analyze inputs, derive insights, and propose action items based on the context of discussions.
- Sentiment Analysis: Leverages AI to identify points of agreement and disagreement among team members, enabling deeper sense-making.
- Real-Time Listening: Detects when users have finished speaking or need additional information, prompting non-linear follow-ups or clarifications if necessary.

questions.query: For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]â€”for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

data.title: From interviews to deliberation
data.description:
- Reasoning Capabilities: 
   - Incorporates basic agentic workflows to analyze inputs and ask follow-up questions based on the session context and participant's responses.
- Improved Summaries: 
   - Leverages models with larger context window (e.g. Gemini) and better prompts to identify points of agreement and disagreement among participants, enabling better summaries with deeper insights and fewer hallucinations.
- Cross-pollination:
   - Detects when a response is relevant to other participants' responses and asks to comment on those ideas or requests additional information / clarification if necessary.

data.text:
Thanks to GG22 grant, we were able to deliver on our promises with the new version of Harmonica.
These features make it even more powerful and versatile tool for collective sensemaking:

- It is using a mix of several models (Claude + Gemini + GPT 4o Mini)
- It generates better summaries thanks to Gemini
- It generates better prompts thanks to Claude
- It can now generate follow-up questions based on responses from other participants (cross-pollination) which enables indirect deliberation
- It is now much easier to manage different prompts using internal admin panel

data.name: Gitcoin
data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

questions.query: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: Harmonica is a tool that's already being used by a number of communities who are working on OSS projects including Metagov, RnDAO, Sensemaking Scenius, Zuvillage Pop-up Village, Newspeak House. All of those communities have used Harmonica for async collective sensemaking, e.g. strategic planning and retrospectives. We actively participated in Metagov's Interoperable Deliberative Tools cohort which only accepted OSS projects. Harmonica is also mentioned as a recommended deliberation tool in the recent How to DAO book by Kevin Owocki.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation: Harmonica is using GenAI to enable fast collective sensemaking based on popular facilitation frameworks. It allows remote teams and online communities to collaborate 10x more effectively by running async sessions (workshops) aimed at producing specific outputs such as proposals, OKRs, roadmaps, theories of change, etc. It's a post-GPT alternative to forums, Miro workshops and surveys. We enable structured deliberation with various templates (prompts) and user-friendly chat UI (similar to ChatGPT). Hosts can use GenAI to generate ad-hoc templates and interrogate session transcripts to extract specific insights, which can be exported into JSON for additional interoperability.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation: We received 530 contributions and $4,349 of matching funds in GG22, which allowed us to build two critical features: cross-pollination (allowing indirect deliberation within a session) and workspaces (allowing team management and multi-session processes). We plan to iterate on these features, as well as re-design session creation flow and session results pages. Most importantly, we want to enable users to create and share their own templates, using cross-pollination and daisy-chaining, upload additional docs (e.g. meeting transcripts) and allow other agents to connect to Harmonica's MCP server. As a result, Harmonica will become even more powerful and interoperable sensemaking tool.

data.title: Harmonica 1.0
data.description:
The next milestone for Team Harmonica consists of a few interconnected features, which we designed based on the user feedback that we've been collecting since our soft launch in early November 2024.

1. Workspaces (team management and multi-session sensemaking)
2. Better cross-pollination
3. Re-designed session creation flow and session results
4. Enable users to create and share their own templates, using cross-pollination and daisy-chaining, 
5. Uploading additional docs (e.g. meeting transcripts)
6. Allow other agents to connect to Harmonica's MCP server
